page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: STRATFORD SUB CASTLE HAS A JUNIOR WITH THREE CLASSES - CLASS ONE, CLASS TWO AND CLASS THREE. ALTOGETHER THERE ARE 76 CHILDREN IN THE SCHOOL. CLASS ONE'S ROOM WAS BUILT IN 1840 AND THE OTHER CLASSES ARE IN A BUILDING WHICH WAS BUILT IN 1972. AT THE AGE OF 11 THE CHILDREN TAKE A TEST TO SEE WHICH SECONDARY SCHOOL THEY SHOULD ATTEND. THEY WOULD EITHER GO TO HIGHBURY BOYS OR ST EDMUNDS GIRLS SCHOOL WHICH ARE SECONDARY MODERN SCHOOLS OR TO SOUTH WILTS GIRLS OR BISHOP WORDSWORTH BOYS WHICH ARE GRAMMAR SHOOLS. A HUNDRED METRES FROM THE JUNIOR SCHOOL IS A PRIVATE NURSERY SCHOOL. IT HAS 24 CHILDREN AND SIX HELPERS. THE BUILDING IS 99 YEARS OLD BUT THE NURSERY SCHOOL HAS BEEN OPEN FOR ONLY ONE YEAR AND IT IS FOR CHILDREN FROM 3 TO 5 YEARS OF AGE.
